# Agent Skills CLI - Complete Documentation

> The Universal Skill Manager for 42+ AI Coding Agents

Version: 1.0.8
License: MIT
Author: Karanjot Singh
Repository: https://github.com/Karanjot786/agent-skills-cli

---

## Table of Contents

1. Introduction
2. Installation
3. Quick Start
4. Supported Platforms
5. Core Commands
6. Marketplace Commands
7. Export Commands
8. Utility Commands
9. Privacy & Telemetry
10. FAQ

---

## 1. Introduction

Agent Skills CLI is a command-line interface tool designed to help developers install, manage, and synchronize AI coding skills across multiple platforms. With access to over 100,000 skills from the Agent Skills marketplace, developers can enhance their AI coding assistants with specialized capabilities.

### What are Skills?

Skills are Markdown-formatted instruction files that teach AI coding assistants how to perform specific tasks. They can include:
- Step-by-step workflows
- Code templates
- Best practices
- Domain-specific knowledge

---

## 2. Installation

### Use Without Installing (npx)
Run any command instantly without global installation:
```bash
npx agent-skills-cli install @anthropic/xlsx
npx agent-skills-cli search "pdf manipulation"
npx agent-skills-cli list
```

### Global Install (npm)
```bash
npm install -g agent-skills-cli
```

### yarn
```bash
yarn global add agent-skills-cli
```

### pnpm
```bash
pnpm add -g agent-skills-cli
```

### Verify Installation
```bash
skills --version
# Output: 1.0.8
```

> **Note:** All commands below use `skills` (global install). You can replace `skills` with `npx agent-skills-cli` if you haven't installed globally.

---

## 3. Quick Start

### Install Your First Skill
```bash
# With global install:
skills install @anthropic/xlsx

# Or without installing (npx):
npx agent-skills-cli install @anthropic/xlsx
```

### List Installed Skills
```bash
skills list
# or: npx agent-skills-cli list
```

### Search the Marketplace
```bash
skills search "pdf manipulation"
# or: npx agent-skills-cli search "pdf manipulation"
```

---

## 4. Supported Platforms

Agent Skills CLI supports 42+ AI coding platforms:

### Primary Platforms

| Platform | Directory Path | Install Flag |
|----------|---------------|--------------|
| Cursor | `.cursor/skills/` | `-t cursor` |
| Claude Code | `.claude/skills/` | `-t claude` |
| GitHub Copilot | `.github/skills/` | `-t copilot` |
| OpenAI Codex | `.codex/skills/` | `-t codex` |
| Gemini CLI | `.gemini/skills/` | `-t gemini-cli` |
| Windsurf | `.windsurf/skills/` | `-t windsurf` |
| Cline | `.cline/skills/` | `-t cline` |
| Antigravity | `.agent/workflows/` | `-t antigravity` |
| OpenCode | `.opencode/skills/` | `-t opencode` |
| Amp | `.amp/skills/` | `-t amp` |

### Additional Platforms (19 more)

Continue, Trae, Qwen Code, Kiro CLI, Pi, Qoder, Zencoder, Neovate, MCPJam, Mux, OpenHands, Droid, Clawdbot, Crush, Command Code, CodeBuddy, and more.

### Auto-Detection

By default, the CLI auto-detects which platforms are installed in your project directory and installs skills to all detected platforms.

### Platform Targeting

To install to specific platforms:
```bash
skills install @author/skill -a claude,cursor
# or: npx agent-skills-cli install @author/skill -a claude,cursor
```

To install to all platforms:
```bash
skills install @author/skill --all
# or: npx agent-skills-cli install @author/skill --all
```

---

## 5. Core Commands

> All commands work with both `skills` (global install) and `npx agent-skills-cli` (no install needed).

### skills list
List all discovered skills from installed directories.

```bash
skills list
skills list --json
skills list --table
skills list -v  # verbose

# npx equivalent:
npx agent-skills-cli list --json
```

### skills show <name>
Display detailed information about a specific skill.

```bash
skills show xlsx
# or: npx agent-skills-cli show xlsx
```

### skills validate <path>
Validate a skill against the Agent Skills specification.

```bash
skills validate ~/.antigravity/skills/my-skill
# or: npx agent-skills-cli validate ~/.antigravity/skills/my-skill
```

### skills init <name>
Create a new skill from template.

```bash
skills init my-new-skill
skills init my-skill -d /custom/directory

# npx equivalent:
npx agent-skills-cli init my-new-skill
```

### skills check
Check for available skill updates.

```bash
skills check
skills check --agent cursor
skills check --verbose

# npx equivalent:
npx agent-skills-cli check
```

### skills update
Update installed skills to latest versions.

```bash
skills update
skills update skill-name
```

---

## 6. Marketplace Commands

### skills search (s)
Search skills in the marketplace.

```bash
skills search python
skills search "machine learning" --limit 5
skills search react --json

# npx equivalents:
npx agent-skills-cli search python
npx agent-skills-cli search "machine learning" --limit 5
```

### skills install (i)
Install a skill by scoped name.

```bash
skills install <name>
skills install @author/skill
skills install pdf -a cursor,claude
skills install xlsx --all

# npx equivalents:
npx agent-skills-cli install @author/skill
npx agent-skills-cli install pdf -a cursor,claude
```

Options:
- `-p, --platform <platforms>` - Target platforms (comma-separated)
- `-t, --target <platforms>` - Alias for --platform
- `--all` - Install to all platforms

### skills install-url (iu)
Install a skill from a GitHub URL.

```bash
skills install-url https://github.com/user/repo
# or: npx agent-skills-cli install-url https://github.com/user/repo
```

### skills market-uninstall (mu)
Uninstall a marketplace-installed skill.

```bash
skills market-uninstall skill-name
# or: npx agent-skills-cli market-uninstall skill-name
```

---

## 7. Export Commands

### skills export
Export skills to different AI agent formats.

```bash
skills export
skills export -a cursor
skills export -a copilot -d /project
skills export -n xlsx  # export specific skill

# npx equivalent:
npx agent-skills-cli export -a cursor
```

### skills sync
Sync skills to .agent/workflows/ for auto-discovery.

```bash
skills sync
# or: npx agent-skills-cli sync
```

---

## 8. Utility Commands

### skills run <skill> <script>
Execute a script from an installed skill.

```bash
skills run pdf extract_form.py
skills run pdf check.py -a input.pdf

# npx equivalent:
npx agent-skills-cli run pdf extract_form.py
```

### skills scripts <skill>
List available scripts in a skill.

```bash
skills scripts pdf
# or: npx agent-skills-cli scripts pdf
```

### skills info
Show installation status and paths.

```bash
skills info
# or: npx agent-skills-cli info
```

### skills doctor
Diagnose and fix common installation issues.

```bash
skills doctor
skills doctor --fix

# npx equivalent:
npx agent-skills-cli doctor
```

### skills completion <shell>
Generate shell completion script.

```bash
skills completion bash
skills completion zsh
skills completion fish
```

---

## 9. Privacy & Telemetry

Agent Skills CLI collects anonymous usage telemetry to improve the tool. This is completely optional and can be disabled.

### What We Collect
- Command names (install, search, check)
- CLI version
- CI environment detection
- No personal data or skill contents

### Opt Out
Set any of these environment variables:
```bash
export DISABLE_TELEMETRY=1
# or
export DO_NOT_TRACK=1
```

---

## 10. FAQ

### How do I create my own skill?

Use the `skills init` command:
```bash
skills init my-skill
# or: npx agent-skills-cli init my-skill
```

Then edit the generated `SKILL.md` file in your skill directory.

### Can I use skills offline?

Yes, once installed, skills are stored locally and work offline.

### How do I check for updates?

```bash
skills check
# or: npx agent-skills-cli check
```

### How do I uninstall a skill?

```bash
skills market-uninstall skill-name
# or: npx agent-skills-cli market-uninstall skill-name
```

### Where are skills stored?

Skills are stored in platform-specific directories:
- Cursor: `.cursor/skills/`
- Claude: `.claude/skills/`
- Copilot: `.github/skills/`
- Codex: `.codex/skills/`
- Gemini CLI: `.gemini/skills/`
- Windsurf: `.windsurf/skills/`
- Antigravity: `.agent/workflows/`
